name: Albergo Villa Marta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in May 2008. We LOVED it! Family run. Andrea and his staff made this hotel the best during our 2 week trip in Italy. The property is gorgeous, the staff is extremely friendly and knowledgeable about the surrounding area, and the breakfast was wonderful. The rooms are clean and spacious, very unique for Italy. This is a 5-star hotel in my book and anyone traveling in Tuscany should stay here. Only 5 minute drive from Lucca and close to the ocean and the mountains. In a perfect location. My husband and I have already thought about going back! Don't miss this gem of a hotel.
reviews.title: We LOVE this charming hotel!

likes.liked: — The property was beautiful and the staff was amazing.

reviews.text: I am going to be a bit of a spoiler here, after all the superb reviews.
reviews.title: Politely Impeccable, Perhaps a Bit Too Much For Some Folks

likes.liked: — Impeccably clean, very helpful staff and wonderful grounds/views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel in Italy alot, and have stayed in many wonderful places.Albergo Villa Marta is pristeen, serene, impeccable and elegant and made to order.......for certain folks. It is not a casual, laid back environment. It is a great place for folks who wish to be "not seen and not heard." One could hide well here.
reviews.title: A jewel near Lucca

reviews.text: There is a beautiful pool yet, no pool chairs to sit in, or at least there were none in April. The pool was filled, the weather perfect, but no chairs to enjoy, poolside. There is one small pergola that one might sit and enjoy the lovely outdoors.....unless you wish to dine or imbibe at the restaurant/bar tables outside. If you have dinner plans elsewhere ( which we had), then there really is no place to sit outdoors and simply enjoy.....except the uncomfortable seats under the pergola.
reviews.title: Delightful hotel, very convenient for Pisa airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place is really perfection in most ways, unless you want to let "your hair down" even a little. If so, this is NOT the place. I felt as though I needed to speak in hushed tones and tiptoe around, and truly NOT BE SEEN or heard. Not a slam on the actual place. Just an FYI if you choose it.
reviews.title: Very nice and charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned and I had to write a report praising this beautiful hotel. The staff are hand-picked and offer every possible help they can. Elegant in every way, the owners have a lot of style and have made the hotel a reflection of their personalities. Breakfast is a real treat and is taken outside if the weather is good or inside their cantina which is traditionally tuscan in decor as is the rest of the hotel. The quality of every fitting, bathroom and door knob has been lovingly chosen.
reviews.title: elegant and memorable
It was simply a dream!
reviews.text: The restaurant was not fully open as yet (the season is just about to start) so we were not able to sample their cusine other than one night. This was well prepared and presented although limited in choice (this is not really a criticism but reflects that the restaurant was not fully functional ). We do recommend a stay here as although just outside Lucca (only about 15 minutes by car) the opportunity should not be missed. We have stayed in Lucca before but it was a relief to leave the city and enjoy the countryside and peace and quiet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This quaint and beautiful coverted hunting lodge was a dream to have lived in for a week. A holiday my wife and I will never forget. The cleaniness, the warm and welcoming surrondings and the absolutely charming and helpful staff allows us to comfortably recommend this hotel to anyone. Room 114 was really pretty with two windows having two different astonishing views. The owner, Andrea and his wife, Chaira, were so nice and hospitable.
reviews.title: Stylish Country Villa

reviews.text: The breakfast every morning was fresh and varied and the restaurant in the evening was excellent, so much so, that we chose to eat there on two of our seven nights. Situated just outside Lucca in the heart of the amazing Tuscan countryside, allowed us to appreciate the safe and quiet surroundings whilst being about 10 to 15 minutes away from the centre of Lucca.
reviews.title: Bella Toscana experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our recommendation is simple......stop searching and book this hotel now because you definately won't regret it!
reviews.title: Excellent!

likes.disliked: — One waittress could have been a bit friendlier

reviews.text: We stayed for 5 wonderful nights from July 2 to July 6 and would love to go back there again. The Villa and grounds were well maintained, the food at the restaurant was excellent and the whole staff, including the owners, were great. We didn't mind taking taxis or hiring drivers to get around - we day tripped to Lucca, Pisa, Florence, Chianti and Cinque Terre. If you're in Lucca, seek out Trattoria D'Leo - we had dinner there twice!
reviews.title: Albergo Villa Marta We Miss You Already!

reviews.text: We just returned from a three night stay at Albergo Villa Marta. Of the locations we visited in Paris, Italy and England, this was the best. The hotel has the benefits of a hotel with the personal touches of a bed and breakfast. The setting is fantastic - we agreed with other guests that the hotel's website don't really do justice to the hotel. It is better than it appears on the website. The rooms are good sized -- the bathroom is great. Room 111 (on the ground floor at the backside of the villa, right next to the gazebo) will not disappoint. The people who own the hotel are around day and night. Breakfast is very nice. The room smells good and is immaculately clean. The restaurant is wonderful. Make a reservation and eat there one night. (We ate there two out of three nights.) Weather permitting (and it usually is), sit outside and it is perfect. I can't say enough good things. Take a day and visit inside the walls in Lucca. Everyone in the family will love it. Ristorante Cecca (a ten minute walk down the road) is a good spot too, and quite reasonably priced.
reviews.title: You can't go wrong at Albergo Villa Marta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would warmly endorse all the positive ratings already posted here. We could only get in for one night during our week in Tuscany but the small diversion from Pisa to Lucca was well worth the effort. In summary:
reviews.title: Deserves its number one rating

likes.liked: — Tranquil setting and very friendly staff
likes.disliked: — Steps would make disabled acess very difficult

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) Peaceful setting in the countryside so you will need your own transportation to get there.
reviews.title: Gorgeous view, Romantic setting, Fantastic location

likes.liked: — Romance, location, staff, food, scenery, authenticity, service, cleanliness
likes.disliked: — Having to leave after only one nght!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2) Former hunting lodge with excellent period features as well as all mod cons including free internet connection.
reviews.title: Dolce Vita!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We absolutely loved this hotel (B&B). When we first arrived we were concerned that it was not 'inside the old city walls' like our hotels in other cities. Once we arrived, we figured out why we had selected this place. It is stunning and relaxing in a country of thousands of tourists. We could finally relax and enjoy the area.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

likes.liked: — The facility was in great shape and since it was off the beaten path, they had many of the necessities.
likes.disliked: — Without a car, it is more difficult to get around. We were only there for 2 days though.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were able to rent bicycles and rode into the old city walls for the day (20 minute ride).
reviews.title: an amazing place

likes.liked: — great view, breakfast & diining on the terrace, wine list, very clean, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice restaurant (limited menu, but it was big enough for 2 dinners there), the rooms were larger than most we'd experienced in Italy (or anywhere in Europe, aside from major hotels in major cities) and the bathrooms/showers were great (Somewhere between Europe sized and US sized).
reviews.title: Beautiful place but attitude of staff disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks to the staff for a great visit.
reviews.title: Brilliant Villa Marta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In august we spent 5 days in Villa Marta and we must say that we were charmed by this place.
reviews.title: Marta's OK!

description: A former hunting lodge, transformed into a fine and elegant 4-star country resort, deep in the Luccan countryside in the heart of Tuscany, a place where you can enjoy total peace and relaxation, due in no small part to the welcoming and attentive hospitality with which Andrew and Alessia care for their guests. They and their staff will welcome you in person, attending to all your needs with friendly efficiency, contributing to the feeling that you are staying in a country house rather than a hotel.
